body: @anyway1021 could it be closed now?

LGTM

@yonzhang @qingwen220 please help review as well. If no more problem, we could merge the PR tomorrow, it will be a milestone where we start to develop completely independently.
@zombieJ we could start to refactor the service after merging this patch.
Merged into `develop` branch. As to following problems caused by the PR, will refactor on apache repo directly.
Please close it.
Sure, I'll close it now!

looks good fix

Look good to go. But in next checkin, please remove datajoin configuration and also we need think of configuring HBase as storage for hadoop monitoring data.
Now seems we are not configuring storage for application, but by default we use that.
merged

Thanks!

You are right. `dataJoinPollIntervalSec` configuration in the configuration file is useless in this feature.

i will remove it.
merged
This feature must configure Hbase as the storage
This is an old feature moved from Eagle-v0.4
LGTM

Download the patch and build passed. I'll merge it soon.
just close this PR for it's not possible to be merged, it's just for downloading .jar files and place them into directory: ./eagle-assembly/src/main/lib/tomcat/bin/

See branching convention at: https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/EAG/Branching+Convention

ps: Is there any other name format should be considered? Or that's OK

I don't know other cases right now.  

At present, the combination of letters(a-z or A-Z), digits and dot are not enough. '-' is a must to have. 

For example, hdfs ha configuration

dfs.namenode.rpc-address.xxx=yyy
Reviewed, it is a nice change, very straightforward
Reviewed, it is a nice change, very straightforward
I think it is good to go
what is the benefit of using async response?
this PR is for 0.4, but 0.4 is already cut, do you want to submit another PR for develop branch?
reviewed, please merge
reviewed, it is one of first tries of using new app framework
reviewed please merge

reviewed, please merge. Good to see we start to support multiple streaming engines.

Is the following dependency correct, it is 2.7.0?
<dependency>
-            <groupId>org.apache.hadoop</groupId>
-            <artifactId>hadoop-yarn-server-common</artifactId>
-            <version>2.7.0</version>
-        </dependency>
LGTM
@yonzhang  this fix is only for v0.4.
@yonzhang it's wrongly included, removed now.

The main purpose is to wrap the response of java 8 lambda function in standard type. As to Sync/Async, I think both are OK and current consideration is we could control timeout in framework level and avoid uncontrolled IO blocking.
Looks this PR contains commits not merged well. Could we use another pr?
ok, thanks, please merge it soon

As I mentioned, user id conversion is a little bit tricky, it will be great if someone can give me a hint on user id conversion issue. 

Thanks and regards,
Da

By the way, "id converter" will make http request to mapr host.
As mapr use https connection,  " javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException Error" will occur if user didn't add the  certificate to JVM's trust store.

Will update this on related doc later.

Regards,
Da

@DadanielZ reviewed as above.

@DadanielZ thanks, but I think you don't have to reopen another new pull request but could continue to modify and commit on you current branch as any additional changes will append directly to this PR. 

While as a better practice, you are recommended to create an independent feature branch (typically named EAGLE-${JIRA_ID}) from latest apache `develop` branch in your own forked repository for every new pull request instead of using `develop` branch always :-)

@haoch  thanks for your advice! XD 
Working on a feature branch will be a good practice.
LGTM, thanks.
@dbosco Patch applied. Thanks for the contribution and would you pls. close the pull request?

It seems that the PR created a new folder [`build`](/r7raul1984/incubator-eagle/tree/checkstyle-EAGLE416/build) under project root, would you please just put the checkstyle files under [`eagle-dev`](/apache/incubator-eagle/tree/master/eagle-dev) directly?
ok, fixed, and will create another PR
Thanks, in fact, you don't have to reopen another new pull request but could continue to modify and commit on the current branch as any new changes will append directly to this PR.
That is right, we don't need notify application of the web related configuration. Web application should do it by itself by querying ApplicationEntity, I will modify the PR
merged

2. Prefer to rename configuration key "connection" as "metadata.connection"

Jenkins building failed.
Merged, pls. close it.
LGTM
-1 for the early abstraction, we should still use existing implementation and push abstraction after we tested all the applications.

I think the implementation is to provide the foundation for make sure the code modules extensible, as how much code developer should write it's to continue simplifying the interface or DSL.

> - Further, what if the application needs know configuration for eagle server

We should follow the defined interface of Application. For Application standalone mode, the configuration should be passed through configuration file, for Application managed by server, the configuration should be passed through: https://github.com/apache/incubator-eagle/blob/develop/eagle-core/eagle-app/eagle-app-base/src/main/java/org/apache/eagle/app/service/ApplicationContext.java#L70

```
this.config = ConfigFactory.parseMap(executionConfig).withFallback(envConfig);
```

For managed classes, it could easily get server config by `@Inject Config config;`
merged
